title: Unbeaten Fonseca charges into Jeddah title match
description: Joao Fonseca delivered a semi-final clinic on Saturday evening to continue his charge at the Next Gen ATP Finals presented by PIF. The 18-year-old Brazilian raced past Luca Van Assche 4-2, 4-2, 4-1 to book his championship-match spot at the 20-and-under event in Jeddah, where he will take on Learner Tien for the trophy on Sunday from 8 p.m. local time (6 p.m. CET/12 p.m. ET). The No. 145 in the PIF ATP Rankings, Fonseca struck the ball with depth and fierce power off both wings to overwhelm Van Assche and become the lowest-ranked finalist in tournament history. ‚ÄúOn hard courts, [I‚Äôve never had such a good week],‚Äù said Fonseca in his on-court interview. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm playing a very high level. I‚Äôm just very proud of myself and the way that I‚Äôve been with my routine this week, so focused. With my family here, with my three coaches, it‚Äôs really nice and I hope I can go for the title.‚Äù The future is ùêçùêéùêñ üëèThe two youngest players this week will face for the title in Jeddah ‚öîÔ∏è#NextGenATPFinals pic.twitter.com/jMW86MmKYy‚Äî Next Gen ATP Finals (@nextgenfinals) December 21, 2024 Van Assche was competing in his second-straight semi-final in Jeddah but was unable to stick with Fonseca, who is the second-youngest competitor in Next Gen ATP Finals presented by PIF history after 2019 champion Jannik Sinner. The Brazilian converted four of 14 break points he earned, according to Infosys ATP Stats, while he did not face any on his own serve. ‚ÄúToday was a great match. I played really solidly,‚Äù said Fonseca. ‚ÄúI did what I talked about with my coach. He didn‚Äôt have too many chances because I was playing so aggressively and making all the shots. There is one more match to go, and I hope I can for it.‚Äù The one-hour encounter against Van Assche was in stark contrast to Fonseca‚Äôs five-set victory against Jakub Mensik 24 hours earlier, when the Brazilian prevailed in five sets that all went to tie-breaks. His group-stage campaign also included the biggest win of his career by PIF ATP Ranking against World No. 20 Arthur Fils. Fonseca began the week as the lowest seed in an eight-man field but is now the only undefeated player left standing after Tien earlier defeated Alex Michelsen in the opening semi-final of the day. Sunday‚Äôs final at King Abdullah Sports City will be the second Lexus ATP Head2Head meeting of the week between Fonseca and Tien, after the Brazilian claimed a four-set triumph in the group stage. What is the prize money for the Next Gen ATP Finals Presented by PIF IN $US? The prize money for the Next Gen ATP Finals Presented by PIF is $2,050,000. excerpt: Joao Fonseca delivered a semi-final clinic on Saturday to continue his charge at the Next Gen ATP Finals presented by PIF. The 18-year-old Brazilian raced past Luca Van Assche in straight sets to book his final spot.

html:
Match Report

Unbeaten Fonseca charges into Jeddah title match

Brazilian downs Van Assche, will meet Tien for Next Gen ATP Finals presented by PIF title

December 21, 2024

Peter Staples/ATP¬†Tour

Joao Fonseca charges unbeaten into the Next Gen ATP Finals presented by PIF title match. By Andy West

Joao Fonseca delivered a semi-final clinic on Saturday evening to continue his charge at the Next Gen ATP Finals presented by PIF.

The 18-year-old Brazilian raced past Luca Van Assche 4-2, 4-2, 4-1 to book his championship-match spot at the 20-and-under event in Jeddah, where he will take on Learner Tien for the trophy on Sunday from 8 p.m. local time (6 p.m. CET/12 p.m. ET). The No. 145 in the PIF ATP Rankings, Fonseca struck the ball with depth and fierce power off both wings to overwhelm Van Assche and become the lowest-ranked finalist in tournament history.

‚ÄúOn hard courts, [I‚Äôve never had such a good week],‚Äù said Fonseca in his on-court interview. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm playing a very high level. I‚Äôm just very proud of myself and the way that I‚Äôve been with my routine this week, so focused. With my family here, with my three coaches, it‚Äôs really nice and I hope I can go for the title.‚Äù

‚Äî Next Gen ATP Finals (@nextgenfinals) December 21, 2024

Van Assche was competing in his second-straight semi-final in Jeddah but was unable to stick with Fonseca, who is the second-youngest competitor in Next Gen ATP Finals presented by PIF history after 2019 champion Jannik Sinner. The Brazilian converted four of 14 break points he earned, according to Infosys ATP Stats, while he did not face any on his own serve.

‚ÄúToday was a great match. I played really solidly,‚Äù said Fonseca. ‚ÄúI did what I talked about with my coach. He didn‚Äôt have too many chances because I was playing so aggressively and making all the shots. There is one more match to go, and I hope I can for it.‚Äù

The one-hour encounter against Van Assche was in stark contrast to Fonseca‚Äôs five-set victory against Jakub Mensik 24 hours earlier, when the Brazilian prevailed in five sets that all went to tie-breaks. His group-stage campaign also included the biggest win of his career by PIF ATP Ranking against World No. 20 Arthur Fils.

Fonseca began the week as the lowest seed in an eight-man field but is now the only undefeated player left standing after Tien earlier defeated Alex Michelsen in the opening semi-final of the day. Sunday‚Äôs final at King Abdullah Sports City will be the second Lexus ATP Head2Head meeting of the week between Fonseca and Tien, after the Brazilian claimed a four-set triumph in the group stage.

What is the prize money for the Next Gen ATP Finals Presented by PIF IN $US?
The prize money for the Next Gen ATP Finals Presented by PIF is $2,050,000.
Undefeated Champion: $526,480
Final Win: $153,000
Semi-Final Win: $113,500
Each Round-Robin Match Win: $36,660
Participation Fee: $150,000
Alternate: $15,000

View TV Schedule
